text: The Congress leadership sought an explanation from CM Siddaramaiah over corruption allegations linked to the Mysore Urban Development Authority and Valmiki ST Development Corporation. Governor Thaawar Chand Gehlot requested a report on the matter. The party's internal discord and factionalism were also discussed, with BJP planning a padayatra to exploit the situation.
title: Congress high command asks Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah to explain graft charges against him

text: A domestic help was caught stealing gold and diamond ornaments over six months from her employer's upscale Bengaluru home. The theft was discovered when the family returned from a vacation in France. Police arrested the help, Divya, along with her aunt and an accomplice. Stolen items were recovered from their possession and various shops.
title: Help steals Rs 60 lakh gold from VC firm MD's house in Bengaluru

text: Diplomatic representatives from Japan, Germany, Australia, Switzerland, and Israel have praised Bengaluru for its cosmopolitan nature and thriving tech industry. The city's unique blend of modernity and tradition, as seen in its green spaces and diverse cuisine, has made it a hub for international businesses and professionals. These qualities make Bengaluru an appealing place to work and live.
title: Diplomats’ love letter to Bengaluru
Landslides disrupt journey to coast
Bagalur KIA route barely qualifies as rd: Commuters

text: A 39-year-old priest, Dayanand, was arrested for allegedly raping a 26-year-old software engineer in Bengaluru. The survivor had visited the Puradamma temple in Arsikere where Dayanand convinced her to conduct a special puja. He later assaulted her twice and extorted Rs 87,000. Three additional related incidents were also reported.
title: Priest arrested for raping and extorting Bengaluru techie
Students who failed SSLC/PU can continue in school next yr
Man who gave mule accounts to Dubai-based crooks held
Darshan files fresh petition for home food
Mysuru District teams advance

text: Karnataka transformed from a power-deficient state in late 2023 to a power-surplus state in 2024, selling Rs 1,403 crore worth of power. Daily, Karnataka returns 20 million units to Punjab and Uttar Pradesh. Energy Minister KJ George credited timely measures and a good monsoon for this turnaround, with significant profits reported from major thermal plants.
title: From crisis to sales, Karnataka makes powerful turnaround
Chandrasekaran named Intel’s chief global operations officer
Red-hot Rio rides to glory

text: Home Minister G Parameshwara announced the government would not grant official permission for the BJP-JD(S) seven-day padayatra from Bengaluru to Mysuru but would ensure safety arrangements. The padayatra aims to pressure CM Siddaramaiah to resign over alleged development scams. Congress plans a political counter move. Preparations for the march began, emphasizing their fight for Scheduled Castes and Tribes.
title: No nod for padayatra but govt won’t stop it: Karnataka home minister G Parameshwara

text: The Australian Bureau of Statistics reported a 1.0% increase in the consumer price index for the June quarter, aligning with predictions. The annual CPI inflation rate hit 3.8%. Core inflation rose 0.8%, falling below expectations. The Reserve Bank of Australia maintained interest rates at 4.35% due to concerns over the labor market and economic stagnation.
title: Australian CPI inflation rises by 1% in June quarter
Stock market today: Sensex rises over 200 points to 81,680; Nifty at 24,930

text: Germany's economy unexpectedly contracted in the second quarter, with GDP dipping by 0.1%, as reported by Destatis. Weak investment drove the downturn, contrasting with slight growth in the rest of the eurozone. Analysts predict continued stagnation, citing external factors and domestic issues like high energy costs and a transitioning automotive sector.
title: German economy contracts unexpectedly in second quarter
Byju’s close to resolving Rs 159 crore dispute with BCCI

text: RBI issued new directives on wilful defaulters, urging banks to assess borrowers' intent before classifying them. An identification committee, including a whole-time director, will examine evidence. Decisions should consider borrowers' track records, not isolated incidents. Cases of fund misuse and deliberate default were highlighted, aiming for thorough investigation before tagging defaulters.
title: Intent key before applying wilful defaulter tag: RBI

text: India was projected to become Glenmorangie's largest market within a decade due to the growing whiskey demand. The India-UK free trade agreement could lower tariffs, making premium brands more affordable. Caspar MacRae, CEO of Glenmorangie, pointed out that lower tariffs could benefit consumers and allow for more competition in the market.
title: Single malt co Glenmorangie sees India as top mkt in 10 years

text: Public sector banks collected Rs 8,495 crore in fines over five years for non-maintenance of minimum balance, averaging Rs 1,699 crore annually. Despite SBI ceasing such charges, other banks like Punjab National Bank and Bank of Baroda increased collections. This amount surpassed government incentives for digital payments in the budget, highlighting the financial impact on depositors.
title: Min balance fines fetch PSBs Rs 8.5k crore in 5 years

text: Commerce & Industry Minister Piyush Goyal ruled out an immediate change in India's stance on Chinese investments, attributing previous dependence on imports to UPA's policies. He emphasized the government's steps toward self-reliance and criticized UPA for the trade deficit with China. Goyal also highlighted the government's decision not to sign the RCEP trade deal to safeguard national interests.
title: Piyush Goyal rules out change in FDI policy for China
Sebi bats for making T+0 system mandatory for all
Tatas drop plan to buy India business of Vivo

text: On Tuesday, Sebi proposed measures to curb speculative trading in index derivatives, including increasing the minimum contract value to Rs 30 lakh. The regulator's consultation paper suggested several changes aimed at reducing excessive F&O trading, such as limiting weekly contract expirations and requiring brokers to collect options premiums upfront. This move follows warnings about excessive speculation impacting the economy.
title: Sebi eyes 6x contract value hike to curb F&O speculation

text: India's recent budget decision to increase customs duty on laboratory chemicals from 10% to 150% has impacted research centres and labs, significantly straining their financial resources. Academic institutes have seen a surge in costs, prompting calls for exemption from the new tax to avoid jeopardizing the country's research environment.
title: Duty on chemicals up from 10% to 150%; research labs lose work
GAIL net profit vaults 77% to 3,183cr in Q1
Adani Energy raises $1bn in share sale

text: Biopharma firm Biological E Limited obtained World Health Organisation pre-qualification for its Novel Oral Polio Vaccine type 2. This designation is the 10th WHO pre-qualification for the Hyderabad firm. The nOPV2 vaccine, which showed promising results in clinical trials, significantly decreases the risk of cVDPV2 outbreaks and is targeted at countries affected by such outbreaks, BE stated.
title: Biological E's nOPV2 polio vax get WHO prequalification

text: ITR filing FY 2023-24: The correct ITR form for assessment year 2024-25 depends on the level of your income and a host of other factors. Do remember that from financial year 2023-24, the new income tax regime is the default income tax regime.
title: ITR Filing FY 2023-24: Which is the correct Income Tax Return form for salaried taxpayers - ITR-1 or ITR-2? Find out

text: A SpiceJet flight heading to Delhi with 160 passengers made a precautionary landing at Bagdogra airport due to a technical issue. The pilot returned the aircraft safely within fifteen minutes of takeoff. All passengers were safely disembarked, and an alternate aircraft was arranged. The original aircraft will undergo a complete safety check before flying again.
title: SpiceJet flight from Bagdogra airport returns due to technical issue, alternate flight arranged

text: August 2024 Bank Holidays: In August, banks across India were closed for up to 13 days due to Sundays, national holidays, and regional festivals. Key closures included Ker Puja in Agartala, Tendong Lho Rum Faat in Sikkim, Patriot's Day in Manipur, and Independence Day nationwide.
title: August 2024 Bank Holidays: Banks closed up to 13 days - check full list of state-wise bank holidays

text: PM Modi on Budget 2024: PM Modi said that India, which is currently the world’s fifth largest economy, will soon become the third largest. He also noted the time when India had been ranked among the ‘Fragile Five’ economies in the world.
title: Budget 2024 three times UPA's last Budget in 2014: PM Narendra Modi at CII post-Budget conference

text: The APU is a critical piece of aircraft equipment that provides electrical power and air conditioning to a plane while it is on the ground. The APU is what keeps the passenger cabin cooled when the aircraft is on ground. Airlines rely either on APU or an external ground power unit to run the cabin air conditioning when the jet engines are off.
title: Air India and Honeywell sign agreement for auxiliary power unit aftermarket support

text: A 40-year-old man was acquitted by a Chengalpet mahila court after a schoolgirl revealed that her sexual assault allegations were false and made under her father's influence to settle a personal score. Medical tests confirmed no rape occurred, and the girl testified that her father forced her to sign the complaint.
title: Chengalpattu rape case turns out to be false; girl testifies against father's motive

text: A Class 10 student, T Kishore, tragically died after being struck in the head by a javelin during a sports practice session in Vadalur, Tamil Nadu. The incident, which occurred on July 24, has led to a police case following the father's complaint. Investigations revealed the school lacked a trained physical education teacher and proper facilities for javelin training.
title: Class 10 boy dies as javelin hits head
Madhavaram: 3 roundabouts to be constructed for 2 crore
Urban wetland park that will change Porur’s landscape nears completion
Indian Bank to offer 40k cr of corporate loans in FY25
Leaking Nungambakkam subway to be repaired
TVSSCS records Q1 net of 7.5cr

text: India won the third and final T20I series against Sri Lanka, completing a 3-0 clean sweep. The hosts required just 9 runs off the last two overs with six wickets in hand. However, the game took an unexpected turn when captain Suryakumar Yadav handed the ball to Rinku Singh, a player who had never bowled in his 23-match T20I career, a bold move on a spin-friendly track.
title: 'Felt he was better suited because…': Surya on giving the ball to Rinku

text: India secured a 3-0 victory against Sri Lanka in the third and final T20I of the series in Pallekele. The game took an unexpected turn when captain Suryakumar Yadav handed the ball to Rinku Singh, who had never bowled in his 23-match T20I career. This risky decision, which turned out to be a masterstroke, saw India complete a clean sweep.
title: Watch: Gambhir bursts into a smile as Rinku takes maiden wicket

text: The much-awaited meeting of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) with the Indian Premier League (IPL) owners to discuss the retentions ahead of the mega auction will take place at the board's headquarters in the Wankhede Stadium complex on Wednesday.
tags: Board of Control for Cricket in India
title: IPL: BCCI may allow franchises to retain uncapped players

text: In the third T20I against Sri Lanka, Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav bowled the final over, taking two crucial wickets and pushing the match into a Super Over. Despite India setting a modest target of 137/9, Sri Lanka needed six runs off the last over, but could only level the scores due to Yadav’s impressive bowling performance.
title: Watch: How SKY took the 3rd T20I against SL into a Super Over

text: Sri Lanka suffered their 105th defeat in T20I history, including Super Overs, in the final match against India in Pallekele. The loss surpassed Bangladesh's 104 defeats, followed by the West Indies and Zimbabwe with 101 and 99 respectively. India made a strong recovery, reaching 137/9 in 20 overs, with Shubman Gill leading the scoring.
title: Sri Lanka set unwanted record with most T20I defeats in history

text: Sri Lanka faltered in the final moments of the 3rd T20I against India, forcing the match into a Super Over. Washington Sundar's exceptional bowling restricted Sri Lanka to just 2 runs. Suryakumar Yadav then secured India's victory. This win marks India's third whitewash against Sri Lanka in T20I series. The ODI series begins on Friday in Colombo.
title: Watch: How Sundar's Super Over won the T20I series against SL

text: The IPL Governing Council is set to convene with the owners of all 10 franchises in Mumbai on Wednesday to discuss potential changes to the team purse and retention policies.
title: IPL: Team purse may be increased to Rs 120-125 crore, 5-6 retentions likely

text: Suryakumar Yadav and Rinku Singh turned out to be 'men with golden arm' as Sri Lanka's saga of inexplicable collapses continued in a low-scoring thriller as India won the third T20I in Super Over to complete a 3-0 series whitewash, which didn't look possible in the 38 overs.
title: 'Bowlers' Surya, Rinku star in Super Over win, India sweep T20I series vs Lanka

text: Suryakumar Yadav is filled with happiness as he witnesses the camaraderie and support among his fellow players. He embarks on a path to evolve into a true leader, guiding and inspiring his team beyond the responsibilities of a cricket captain.
title: I don't want to be captain, I want to be the leader: Surya

text: Team India's ODI team captain Rohit Sharma has begun training for the ODI series against Sri Lanka starting on August 2. He shared photos of his practice sessions on social media. The Indian team’s tour began on July 27 with a T20I series, winning the first match by 43 runs and the second by seven wickets. Sharma is returning after leading India to victory in the ICC T20 World Cup. He aims to surpass 11,000 ODI runs and Rahul Dravid’s run tally.
title: Captain Rohit hits the nets before Sri Lanka ODI series

text: Suryakumar and Gambhir share a strong bond dating back to their days with Kolkata Knight Riders in 2014. Gambhir, who was the KKR captain, showed significant faith in Suryakumar, even making him the vice-captain at one point. Is Gambhir viewing Suryakumar, who made a crucial catch in the T20 World Cup final, as a long-term T20I captaincy prospect?
title: 'He plays just one format': Nehra on why Hardik lost captaincy to Surya

text: Sri Lanka announced a 16-member squad for the ODI series against India starting August 2 at the Premadasa Stadium, with subsequent matches on August 4 and 7. The squad, approved by Sports Minister Harin Fernando, includes senior all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne and young batsmen Janith Liyanage and Nishan Madushka. Charith Asalanka leads the team, featuring players like Pathum Nissanka, Avishka Fernando, Kusal Mendis, and Wanindu Hasaranga.
title: Liyanage, Karunaratne back in ODI squad for India series

text: India's Smriti Mandhana climbed to fourth place among batters and Renuka Singh Thakur to fifth among bowlers in the latest ICC T20I rankings. Mandhana's performance in the Women's T20 Asia Cup final contributed to her rise, while Renuka's seven wickets in the tournament boosted her ranking significantly.
title: Smriti Mandhana climbs to fourth, Renuka Singh Thakur ranks fifth

text: In a Tamil Nadu Premier League 2024 match, a Siechem Madurai Panthers pacer's delivery was struck over the fence by a Chepauk Super Gillies batsman. The ball was caught by a local man who refused to return it, expressing his frustration and walking away with it. The Panthers won the match by 9 runs.
title: Watch: Local man refuses to return match ball during TNPL game

text: Ireland's Lorcan Tucker and Andy McBrine completed an all-run five in their second innings during the one-off Test against Zimbabwe, sparking widespread excitement on social media. This event has gone viral, reminding cricket fans of a 1992 incident where India's No.10 and No.11 batters achieved an all-run five in a match against Australia.
title: When Raju & Srinath ran five runs off one ball vs Australia - Watch

text: India have secured victory in the three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka, establishing an insurmountable 2-0 advantage.The ODI series is set to commence on August 2 in Colombo, with all three matches scheduled to take place at the R Premadasa International Cricket Stadium. The second ODI will be held on August 4, and the series will reach its conclusion on August 7.
title: Kohli arrives in Sri Lanka, delights fans with memorable photo moments - Watch

text: India's captain Rohit Sharma arrived in Colombo for the three-match ODI series against Sri Lanka, beginning August 2. Rohit, Virat Kohli, and others commenced their training. A video showed Rohit chatting with ex-Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews. The series will be the first collaboration between Team India coach Gautam Gambhir and Rohit Sharma as captain.
title: Watch: Rohit Sharma meets Angelo Mathews ahead of SL ODIs

text: Shaheen Shah Afridi expressed no ambition to lead the national team, emphasizing that his focus is on winning matches. Afridi was briefly appointed T20I skipper after Babar Azam stepped down post the 2023 ODI World Cup. Afridi's commitment remains towards contributing to Pakistan's success on the field.
title: Never played my cricket for captaincy: Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi

text: Ishan Kishan was part of the ODI World Cup team last year that took place in India, but didn't feature in any of the matches. Following that he abruptly left the Indian Test team in South Africa, citing fatigue. He then missed India domestic cricket going against Indian cricket board's order. Ishan also had a poor IPL 2024 where he managed only 324 runs in 14 games and was then ignored for the T20 World Cup in the Americas which India won.
title: 'Wo fashion me lag gaya': Basit on Ishan's ouster from Team India

text: India will host the Men's Asia Cup in 2025, which will be played in the T20 format, as per the Asian Cricket Council's (ACC) release of an Invitation for Expressions of Interest (IEOI) document on Saturday. This document invites interested parties to submit their IEOI for ACC Sponsorship Rights for the period from 2024 to 2027. The 2023 men’s Asia Cup was hosted by Pakistan and Sri Lanka and was played in the 50-overs format.
title: India to host Men's Asia Cup 2025

text: Mallikarjun Kharge termed the landslides in Kerala as a national disaster, assuring that Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi would visit Wayanad. The Congress party is actively engaged in rehabilitation efforts. The Indian Army has ramped up rescue operations, and the government assured relief and compensation measures. Nearly 70 bodies were recovered, and Kerala observed two days of mourning.
title: ‘An unfortunate incident,’ says Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge on Wayanad landslides

text: Delhi Minister Atishi announced that the government would introduce a law to regulate coaching centres following a tragedy that killed three UPSC aspirants due to waterlogging caused by illegal encroachments. Illegal operations in basements and blocked drainage systems were identified as contributors. The Junior Engineer responsible was terminated, and the Assistant Engineer was suspended. A magisterial report is awaited in six days to identify accountable officials. The government has started sealing basements and issuing notices to coaching centres, and a committee will be formed to develop regulations. Fee reductions will also be requested from the centres.
title: Rajender Nagar tragedy: Delhi minister Atishi promises strict action against officials, announces plans for coaching institute regulation act

text: Manuj Kathuria was arrested after his SUV allegedly caused water displacement that led to the drowning of three IAS aspirants at a flooded coaching center in Old Rajinder Nagar. His wife, Shima, argued that Manuj was unaware of the incident and attributed the gate's collapse to prior weakening from frequent waterlogging.
title: My husband is a victim, not accused: Wife of SUV driver held in Delhi coaching centre deaths case

text: Aurobindo Pharma's non-executive director Sarath Reddy was identified as a key accused by the CBI in the alleged Delhi liquor scam, as detailed in their chargesheet. Reddy, who turned approver in the ED's investigation, was implicated in the cartelization of licenses and kickbacks. His company procured over Rs 50 crore in electoral bonds, with significant portions going to BJP, BRS, and TDP. Reddy allegedly paid AAP Rs 25 crore for control over retail zones. Funds were supposedly used by AAP for the Goa election campaign, implicating several individuals, including CM Arvind Kejriwal and MLA Durgesh Pathak.
title: Pharma's non-executive director Sarath Reddy key accused in Delhi liquor scam, says was threatened by BRS leader K Kavitha

text: A video surfaced showing Delhi policemen having a liquor party at a builder’s house, hinting at a possible nexus between law enforcement and builders. The DCP (southeast) has directed immediate action against the eight officers involved. An inquiry revealed the incident occurred weeks ago and included alcohol and hookah. The situation is being thoroughly investigated to confirm any illegal construction ties. This incident follows a 2023 case where officers faced repercussions for organizing a celebration within police premises involving a criminal. The inquiry is ongoing to determine further actions.
title: 'On the rocks': 8 cops in trouble over booze bash at builder’s house in Delhi

text: Three students tragically died in a flooded basement at Rau's IAS Study Circle in Old Rajender Nagar, Delhi. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) attributed the flooding to several infrastructural issues, including encroached stormwater drains, a lack of barriers, and the road's saucer-like depression. The security staff failed to notice excessive rainwater entering the basement. MCD officials emphasized that other nearby properties had sufficient barriers to prevent such flooding. An ongoing investigation revealed that many properties in the area had converted to commercial use, consequently obstructing stormwater drains and raising safety concerns.
title: 'Not the drains': How design flaws in IAS coaching center led to flooding that killed 3 UPSC aspirants

text: IndiGo and SpiceJet cancelled four flights to Leh due to an unprecedented heat wave, marking four consecutive days of disruptions. Temperatures over 32°C at Leh Airport, situated 3.3 km above sea level, caused operational issues. This is reportedly the first time extreme heat has led to such cancellations at this high-altitude airport.
title: Grounded at high altitude: For 4th straight day, flights to Leh cancelled due to record heatwave

text: Civil services aspirants in Delhi began an indefinite hunger strike after three students died in a flooded basement of a coaching center. Over 400 students protested, demanding Rs 5 crore compensation for the victims' families, an FIR report, and measures to prevent basement use for libraries and classes. Delhi Police are in constant contact with the protesters.
title: Delhi coaching center tragedy: USPC aspirants on hunger strike; AAP minister Atishi to make 'big' announcement shortly

text: Monsoon rains in New Delhi offered some relief to the Yamuna River, reducing faecal coliform levels but leaving the water highly contaminated. The biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) remained above acceptable limits, indicating persistent pollution. Despite improvements, the river continued to show signs of severe contamination, with frothy, foul-smelling water observed in several stretches.
title: Yamuna breathes easy after rains, but just; pollutant levels alarming

text: A 32-year-old woman fell from a moving autorickshaw near Huda City Centre in Gurgaon after two men on a bike snatched her iPhone and sped away. Injured, she received medical treatment. Police are investigating the case using CCTV footage to identify the assailants, who were not wearing helmets during the incident.
title: Gurgaon: Woman falls off auto as two men on bike snatch iPhone & flee

text: Congress MP Alfred Arthur criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's absence in Manipur during a speech on the Budget discussion. Despite 15 months of chaos and displacement, Arthur lamented that BJP has not replaced CM Biren Singh. He expressed fears for his community and thanked Rahul Gandhi and others for their support in visiting the troubled state.
title: Can’t you hear cries of women, kids in Manipur, MP asks PM
No conclusive data on pollution-disease link: Government

text: The Delhi government increased its electric bus fleet by 320, making the total count 1,970. These buses are part of a broader plan to reduce carbon emissions and enhance public transport. Since January 2022, electric buses have saved 91,000 tonnes of CO2. The city aims for 10,480 public buses by 2025, with 80% being electric.
title: Greener Delhi: 320 buses added to electric fleet, total now close to 2k

Registration starts in early August, ensuring a transparent, online process for seat allotment.
title: Centre Assures Action on NEET Paper Leak Allegations

text: The struggle for IIT graduates to secure jobs is intensifying, with unplaced numbers doubling over two years. This trend highlights a growing skills mismatch, overreliance on campus placements, and economic downturns. The IIT brand, once a guarantee of lucrative careers, faces scrutiny as thousands remain jobless. Key reasons include skill gaps, lack of soft skills, and limited industry exposure, raising concerns about the employability of engineering graduates.
title: Six Reasons Why Engineering Graduates Are Struggling to Find Jobs

text: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.

text: Nasa's DART spacecraft captured detailed images of asteroids Dimorphos and Didymos just before it deliberately crashed. Although Dimorphos lacks significant cratering, it features several cracks or "faults" across its surface.

text: The FDA approved Guardant Health's Shield blood test for colon cancer screening, making it likely to be covered by Medicare and private insurers. text: Alligators and crocodiles, both belonging to different families within the Crocodylia genus, exhibited distinct traits despite their similarities. Key differences included snout shape, visibility of teeth, skin color, behavior, feet structure, and habitat preference. Alligators had U-shaped snouts and were less aggressive, while crocodiles possessed V-shaped snouts and were more territorial.

text: Carbon monoxide, a colorless and odorless gas, previously posed severe health risks when it accumulated in the bloodstream, causing tissues to be deprived of oxygen, leading to serious damage or death. Common sources included vehicles, gas appliances, and wood stoves. Symptoms such as headache and dizziness resembled flu without fever, making immediate medical attention crucial for suspected poisoning.
title: Why carbon monoxide is deadly; key facts to know

text: The article dissected the distinctions between toads and frogs, highlighting their taxonomic differences, physical traits, and natural habitats. text: A 39-year-old priest, Dayanand, was arrested for allegedly raping a 26-year-old software engineer in Bengaluru. The survivor had visited the Puradamma temple in Arsikere where Dayanand convinced her to conduct a special puja. He later assaulted her twice and extorted Rs 87,000. Three additional related incidents were also reported.
title: Priest arrested for raping and extorting Bengaluru techie

text: The veteran actress talks about wanting to go beyond playing the sweet maa and daadi roles
title: Farida Jalal: I feel angry that filmmakers have never seen me in ...

text: India won the third and final T20I series against Sri Lanka, completing a 3-0 clean sweep. The hosts required just 9 runs off the last two overs with six wickets in hand. However, the game took an unexpected turn when captain Suryakumar Yadav handed the ball to Rinku Singh, a player who had never bowled in his 23-match T20I career, a bold move on a spin-friendly track.
title: 'He was better suited because…': Surya on giving the ball to Rinku

text: Bombay High Court recently declined a request to quash an FIR against a Chembur man, his father, and three married sisters accused of cruelty under Section 498A of the IPC. The allegations included making the complainant, a newlywed woman, perform household chores and show proof via video calls. The complainant also accused them of demanding gifts from her parents and retaining her jewellery. The court found the allegations serious enough to warrant concern for the complainant's safety, suggesting the offences were aimed at extorting money and valuables from her family.
title: Making wife show clean home to in-laws on video sadistic: Bombay HC

text: Kelly Haston, a 53-year-old biologist, completed a year-long NASA simulation called CHAPEA Mission 1 in Texas to study the impact of isolation on health and performance for future Mars missions. The crew, cut off from the outside world, conducted simulated Marswalks and grew crops. Haston reflected that separation from loved ones was the most challenging aspect.
title: One year on 'Mars': What did Nasa learn from CHAPEA Mission 1

text: Manu Bhaker made history by winning her second bronze medal at the Olympic Games, becoming the first Indian to earn two medals post-Independence. Partnering with Sarabjot Singh in the 10m air pistol mixed team event, Bhaker's persistence paid off despite the pressure. Coach Jaspal Rana played a crucial role in her success.
title: Paris Olympics: Two in the bag, super Manu Bhaker not done yet

text: Megan Thee Stallion performed at Kamala Harris' campaign event at Georgia State University in Atlanta, with the rally drawing around 10,000 attendees. The event featured performances by Megan Thee Stallion and Quavo, and Harris focused on key issues including price gouging and immigration. Harris' campaign has raised $200 million and gathered significant volunteer support ahead of the election.
title: Watch: Megan Thee Stallion performs in Kamala Harris event

text: India secured a 3-0 victory against Sri Lanka in the third and final T20I of the series in Pallekele. The game took an unexpected turn when captain Suryakumar Yadav handed the ball to Rinku Singh, who had never bowled in his 23-match T20I career. This risky decision, which turned out to be a masterstroke, saw India complete a clean sweep.
title: Watch: Gambhir bursts into a big smile seeing Rinku's bowling heroics

text: In the third T20I against Sri Lanka, Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav bowled the final over, taking two crucial wickets and pushing the match into a Super Over. Despite India setting a modest target of 137/9, Sri Lanka needed six runs off the last over, but could only level the scores due to Yadav’s impressive bowling performance.
title: Watch: How SKY took the 3rd T20I against Sri Lanka into a Super Over

text: Civil services aspirants in Delhi began an indefinite hunger strike after three students died in a flooded basement of a coaching center. Over 400 students protested, demanding Rs 5 crore compensation for the victims' families, an FIR report, and measures to prevent basement use for libraries and classes. Delhi Police are in constant contact with the protesters.
title: Delhi tragedy: UPSC aspirants on hunger strike; Atishi to make 'big' announcement shortly

text: Violent confrontations erupted between demonstrators and law enforcement near a mosque in Southport, UK. The unrest followed a stabbing that killed three children. Authorities believe the demonstrators are linked to the English Defence League, an extreme right-wing group. Vehicles were set on fire, and police used riot shields and dogs in an attempt to disperse the crowd.
title: UK stabbing: Violent clashes break out over attack that killed 3 children

text: IndiGo and SpiceJet cancelled four flights to Leh due to an unprecedented heat wave, marking four consecutive days of disruptions. Temperatures over 32°C at Leh Airport, situated 3.3 km above sea level, caused operational issues. This is reportedly the first time extreme heat has led to such cancellations at this high-altitude airport.
title: For 4th straight day, flights to Leh cancelled due to heatwave

text: Gabriel Medina's incredible wave ride in Tahiti, skillfully captured by AFP's Jerome Brouillet, has become an iconic image of surfing and the 2024 Paris Olympics. The photograph showcases Medina's triumphant exit from the wave with a record Olympic score, rapidly gaining global attention and millions of shares online.
title: Why this Brazilian Olympic surfer's pose has gone viral

text: A recent Bloomberg poll shows Vice President Kamala Harris holding a slight edge over former President and Republican candidate Donald Trump in six out of seven key swing states. Harris leads by 11% in Michigan and by 2 points in Arizona, Wisconsin, and Nevada. However, Trump is ahead of Harris by 4 points in Pennsylvania and 2 points in North Carolina, with equal support in Georgia.
title: Kamala Harris and Trump neck-and-neck in US Presidential race

text: As July comes to a close, India is set to experience 9-10% excess rainfall for the month, resulting in a cumulative total of 2% above normal for the monsoon season. However, rainfall distribution remains uneven, with central and south India receiving ample rain, while northwest and eastern regions face significant deficits. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), 36% of India's districts have reported deficient or 'large deficient' rains, notably affecting areas like Jharkhand, Bihar, Gangetic Bengal, and parts of Punjab and Haryana.
title: Despite good July rain, 36% of districts across India in deficit

text: Sri Lanka faltered in the final moments of the 3rd T20I against India, forcing the match into a Super Over. Washington Sundar's exceptional bowling restricted Sri Lanka to just 2 runs. Suryakumar Yadav then secured India's victory. This win marks India's third whitewash against Sri Lanka in T20I series. The ODI series begins on Friday in Colombo.
title: Watch: How Sundar's Super Over won the T20I series against Sri Lanka

text: On Tuesday, PM Modi emphasised his government's commitment to a 'nation first' approach and the support for private sector investment at a CII post-budget event. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rebutted opposition claims that the budget neglected certain states, asserting increases in allocations for agriculture, health, and social sectors, and criticized the previous UPA government's financial management.
title: Be the primary driving force of development: PM Modi to private sector

text: The landslides that struck Wayanad in Kerala highlighted the ongoing failure to designate the Western Ghats as an eco-sensitive area (ESA). Despite multiple draft notifications over the years, final consensus remains elusive, leaving the terrain vulnerable to hazardous activities like deforestation, mining, and construction, which contribute to landslides during heavy rains.
title: Kerala landslide: This is why Western Ghats need to be tagged eco-sensitive area

text: The Israeli military stated its fighter jets killed Hezbollah's senior military commander Fuad Shukr in an airstrike in Beirut. He was accused of orchestrating a rocket attack on the Golan Heights, resulting in the deaths of 12 youths. The strike has heightened tensions in the Middle East and caused civilian casualties, including two children.
title: Israeli airstrike in Beirut kills 3, IDF says 'eliminated' Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr

text: India's 500 MWe sodium-cooled prototype fast breeder reactor (PFBR) at Kalpakkam has received approval from the Atomic Energy Regulatory Board (AERB) to begin operationalising. This development allows for nuclear fuel loading and initiation of the chain reaction. Once operational, India will join Russia as the only countries with commercially operating fast breeder reactors.
title: India’s most advanced fast breeder reactor gets regulator’s nod for loading N-fuel

text: A devastating natural disaster hit Wayanad, Kerala, as two landslides within hours buried towns and plantation villages, resulting in 126 deaths and 196 injuries. Rescue operations, including Army, Navy, and NDRF teams, continued as they searched for over 100 missing people. Predictions of heavy rainfall had underestimated the actual downpour, leading to significant destruction.
title: Twin landslides in Wayanad kill 126, around 100 missing

text: Nine women from Uttarakhand were abducted in Thailand and taken to Myanmar for forced work in cyber-crime hubs. Family members reported brutal torture and threats of sexual assault. Efforts are underway to rescue these women and other victims. The Indian government recently secured the release of 11 citizens from similar conditions in Myanmar.
title: 'Stripped, beaten': Now, 9 U'khand women captive in Myanmar forced to work in 'scam call centres'

text: US Vice President Kamala Harris supported Israel's right to defend itself after an airstrike in Beirut targeted a Hezbollah commander. The strike, which resulted in deaths, followed a recent rocket attack in the Golan Heights. Harris underscored Israel's security concerns amidst international condemnation and heightened regional tensions.
title: 'Israel has right to defend': Harris following airstrike on Lebanon

text: Commerce & Industry Minister Piyush Goyal ruled out an immediate change in India's stance on Chinese investments, attributing previous dependence on imports to UPA's policies. He emphasized the government's steps toward self-reliance and criticized UPA for the trade deficit with China. Goyal also highlighted the government's decision not to sign the RCEP trade deal to safeguard national interests.
title: Piyush Goyal rules out change in FDI policy for China

text: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. This warning stemmed from multiple M-class solar flares and CMEs, suggesting potential G3 conditions. Periods of G2 are also anticipated. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.
title: Dazzling Auroras possible as geomagnetic storms likely to hit earth

text: Federal health authorities have urged consumers to check their spice racks for ground cinnamon products due to elevated lead levels. The FDA recommended recalls for nine brands, warning prolonged exposure could cause serious health issues. Several companies, including American Spices and Advance Food International, have issued recalls for affected products. Consumers are advised to seek refunds.
title: Ground cinnamon recalled in US due to elevated levels of lead

Who was Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief killed in Iran?

text: Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief, was killed in an attack on his residence in Tehran, as announced by both Hamas and Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps. Haniyeh was in Tehran for President Masoud Pezeshkian's swearing-in. The IRGC is investigating the incident. "The cause is under investigation and will be announced soon," it added.
title: Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh assassinated in Iran

text: Photos of French President Emmanuel Macron and Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra sharing an affectionate moment at the 2024 Paris Olympics opening ceremony have sparked online debate. The incident, highlighted by Madame Figaro magazine, drew mixed reactions, with some critics disapproving of the public display of affection.
title: 'Indecent': Macron's awkward embrace with sports minister at Paris Olympics raises eyebrows

text: This week, hundreds of merchants protested at the offices of PDD Holdings Inc in southern China, accusing the owner of the Temu platform of imposing unfair penalties. The suppliers, primarily small businesses selling Chinese goods to Western consumers via Temu, gathered outside the company's Guangzhou office on Monday. They held placards and chanted slogans, with some entering the offices, though they dispersed without meeting senior executives.
title: Hundreds of China merchants join protest against Temu
